house_prices.models package

Submodules

house_prices.models.basic_model module

Basic model implementation.

infer_signature (from mlflow.models) → Captures input-output schema for model tracking.

num_features → List of numerical feature names. cat_features → List of categorical feature names. target → The column to predict. parameters → Hyperparameters for LightGBM. catalog_name, schema_name → Database schema names for Databricks tables.

class house_prices.models.basic_model.BasicModel(config: ProjectConfig, tags: Tags, spark: SparkSession)[source]

Bases: object

A basic model class for house price prediction using LightGBM.

This class handles data loading, feature preparation, model training, and MLflow logging.

load_data() → None[source]

Load training and testing data from Delta tables.

Splits data into features (X_train, X_test) and target (y_train, y_test).

load_latest_model_and_predict(input_data: DataFrame) → ndarray[source]

Load the latest model from MLflow (alias=latest-model) and make predictions.

Alias latest is not allowed -> we use latest-model instead as an alternative.

Parameters:

input_data – Pandas DataFrame containing input features for prediction.

Returns:

Pandas DataFrame with predictions.

log_model() → None[source]

Log the model using MLflow.

prepare_features() → None[source]

Encode categorical features and define a preprocessing pipeline.

Creates a ColumnTransformer for one-hot encoding categorical features while passing through numerical features. Constructs a pipeline combining preprocessing and LightGBM regression model.

register_model() → None[source]

Register model in Unity Catalog.

retrieve_current_run_dataset() → DatasetSource[source]

Retrieve MLflow run dataset.

Returns:

Loaded dataset source

retrieve_current_run_metadata() → tuple[dict, dict][source]

Retrieve MLflow run metadata.

Returns:

Tuple containing metrics and parameters dictionaries

train() → None[source]

Train the model.

house_prices.models.custom_model module

Custom model implementation.

infer_signature (from mlflow.models) → Captures input-output schema for model tracking.

num_features → List of numerical feature names. cat_features → List of categorical feature names. target → The column to predict. parameters → Hyperparameters for LightGBM. catalog_name, schema_name → Database schema names for Databricks tables.

class house_prices.models.custom_model.CustomModel(config: ProjectConfig, tags: Tags, spark: SparkSession, code_paths: list[str])[source]

Bases: object

Custom model class for house price prediction.

This class encapsulates the entire workflow of loading data, preparing features, training the model, and making predictions.

load_data() → None[source]

Load training and testing data from Delta tables.

This method loads data from Databricks tables and splits it into features and target variables.

load_latest_model_and_predict(input_data: DataFrame) → ndarray[source]

Load the latest model (alias=latest-model) from MLflow and make predictions.

Alias latest is not allowed -> we use latest-model instead as an alternative.

Parameters:

input_data – Input data for prediction.

Returns:

Predictions.

Note: This also works model.unwrap_python_model().predict(None, input_data) check out this article: https://medium.com/towards-data-science/algorithm-agnostic-model-building-with-mlflow-b106a5a29535

log_model(dataset_type: Literal['PandasDataset', 'SparkDataset'] = 'SparkDataset') → None[source]

Log the trained model and its metrics to MLflow.

This method evaluates the model, logs parameters and metrics, and saves the model in MLflow.

prepare_features() → None[source]

Prepare features for model training.

This method sets up a preprocessing pipeline including one-hot encoding for categorical features and LightGBM regression model.

register_model() → None[source]

Register the trained model in MLflow Model Registry.

This method registers the model and sets an alias for the latest version.

retrieve_current_run_dataset() → DatasetSource[source]

Retrieve the dataset used in the current MLflow run.

Returns:

The loaded dataset source.

retrieve_current_run_metadata() → tuple[dict, dict][source]

Retrieve metadata from the current MLflow run.

Returns:

A tuple containing metrics and parameters of the current run.

train() → None[source]

Train the model using the prepared pipeline.

class house_prices.models.custom_model.HousePriceModelWrapper(model: object)[source]

Bases: PythonModel

Wrapper class for machine learning models to be used with MLflow.

This class wraps a machine learning model for predicting house prices.

predict(context: PythonModelContext, model_input: DataFrame | ndarray) → dict[str, float][source]

Make predictions using the wrapped model.

Parameters:

  • context – The MLflow context (unused in this implementation).

  • model_input – Input data for making predictions.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the adjusted prediction.
